channel.title: Can some one pelease read my french and correct any mistakes?

item.title: Can some one pelease read my french and correct any mistakes?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:10, topic:255956”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=338153.msg2627672#msg2627672 date=1231900327]

It is translated. I copied the first two paragraphs into a translator and got something that made sense, believe it or not, that is bad.

I write of my local area. My local area is Stratford. I lived in Stratford since I was child and have never disappointed with the area. I had unforgettable experiments and was never disappointed here with Stratford. I hope to persuade you to come and to visit my area and to show you that a big area it is.

Stratford is a very historical area, many unforgettable things intervened there, and there is much more to come.[/quote]

Too bad you don’t actually know since your French, like you said, sucks.
So maybe, just maybe, it actually is correct?

You’ve misunderstood; if something in french goes directly into a translator and makes sense, it’s wrong, as there are several different rulings that come into play that translators don’t add in.[/quote]

I disagree.

Try putting something into a translator, and retranslating back to english.

Superstar arnold Schwarzenegger in the near future is Adam, pilot who has a serious approval the turning point. An evil company illegal has cloned him, and they now try to kill him to hide the evidence. Tears from his beloved family and facing fearfully makes excessive demands he, the Adam race replica opposed the time reclaims his life and saves the world from the underground clone group.

Read full topic

item.title: Can some one pelease read my french and correct any mistakes?
item.dc:creator: @Ske Ske
item.description:
@Ske wrote:

does “puisque” exist?
also, " et vous montrer qu’un grand secteur c’est" I dont think the “c’est” is supposed to be at the end of the line.

i’ve only read the first few sentences, i don’t like french so i wont read the rest

item.title: Can some one pelease read my french and correct any mistakes?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:7, topic:255956”][quote author=Tico135 link=topic=338153.msg2625578#msg2625578 date=1231763151]
It is translated. I copied the first two paragraphs into a translator and got something that made sense, believe it or not, that is bad.

I write of my local area. My local area is Stratford. I lived in Stratford since I was child and have never disappointed with the area. I had unforgettable experiments and was never disappointed here with Stratford. I hope to persuade you to come and to visit my area and to show you that a big area it is.

Stratford is a very historical area, many unforgettable things intervened there, and there is much more to come.[/quote]

Too bad you don’t actually know since your French, like you said, sucks.
So maybe, just maybe, it actually is correct?[/quote]

You’ve misunderstood; if something in french goes directly into a translator and makes sense, it’s wrong, as there are several different rulings that come into play that translators don’t add in.

item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:6, topic:255956”]It is translated. I copied the first two paragraphs into a translator and got something that made sense, believe it or not, that is bad.

[quote]
I write of my local area. My local area is Stratford. I lived in Stratford since I was child and have never disappointed with the area. I had unforgettable experiments and was never disappointed here with Stratford. I hope to persuade you to come and to visit my area and to show you that a big area it is.

Stratford is a very historical area, many unforgettable things intervened there, and there is much more to come.[/quote][/quote]

Too bad you don’t actually know since your French, like you said, sucks.
So maybe, just maybe, it actually is correct?

item.title: Can some one pelease read my french and correct any mistakes?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Yeah, your teacher will see all the literal translations that don’t make any sense, as well as verb tenses you wouldn’t learn until grade 11 or 12 French.

Read full topic
item.source: Can some one pelease read my french and correct any mistakes?

item.title: Can some one pelease read my french and correct any mistakes?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Hmm. My french is very poor, but definitely sounds like a translator. I don’t understand the context in which you’re using the french word “secteur” so often, sounds like something a translator might spit out. Same with a lot of other things.

I was able to make sense of what you are saying but I doubt it’s correct gramatically.

Read full topic
item.source: Can some one pelease read my french and correct any mistakes?

item.title: Can some one pelease read my french and correct any mistakes?
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

Unhandled:

If you wrote this, you probably wouldn’t need us to correct any mistakes. If you just pulled this out of a translator, your teacher will be immediately able to tell.

Yeah, I found out the hard way in my Spanish class.

Read full topic
